metadata.name: AWS Identity Center Identity Provider Change
metadata.comment: Detects a change in the AWS Identity Center (FKA AWS SSO) identity provider. A change in identity provider allows an attacker to establish persistent access or escalate privileges via user impersonation.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND ((lower(LOWER(metadata.product.name)) in ('sso-directory\.amazonaws\.com', 'sso\.amazonaws\.com')) AND (lower(LOWER(metadata.event_code)) in ('associatedirectory', 'disableexternalidpconfigurationfordirectory', 'disassociatedirectory', 'enableexternalidpconfigurationfordirectory')))

output.summary: Detects a change in the AWS Identity Center (FKA AWS SSO) identity provider. A change in identity provider allows an attacker to establish persistent access or escalate privileges via user impersonation.

metadata.objective: False positive: Authorized changes to the AWS account's identity provider References: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/singlesignon/latest/userguide/app-enablement.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/singlesignon/latest/userguide/sso-info-in-cloudtrail.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/service-authorization/latest/reference/list_awsiamidentitycentersuccessortoawssinglesign-on.html
